\title{MatchZoo Documentation}

\maketitle
\sphinxtableofcontents
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}

\sphinxhref{https://travis-ci.org/faneshion/MatchZoo/}{\sphinxincludegraphics{{/home/ubuntu/doc/MatchzooDoc/Template/docs/_build/doctrees/images/6e243b79aad9e9318e4f72ceb0433af834ef6ade/MatchZoo}.svg}}
\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics{{matchzoo-logo}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}

MatchZoo is a toolkit for text matching. It was developed with a focus on facilitating the designing, comparing and sharing of deep text matching models. There are a number of deep matching methods, such as DRMM, MatchPyramid, MV-LSTM, aNMM, DUET, ARC-I, ARC-II, DSSM, and CDSSM, designed with a unified interface. Potential tasks related to MatchZoo include document retrieval, question answering, conversational response ranking, paraphrase identification, etc. We are always happy to receive any code contributions, suggestions, comments from all our MatchZoo users.

\label{\detokenize{matchzoo:matchzoo-package}}\label{\detokenize{matchzoo::doc}}\label{\detokenize{matchzoo:welcome-to-matchzoo-s-documentation}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} verbosity mode, 0 or 1

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Union}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{List}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}{]}{]}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
scalar test loss (if the model has a single output and no
metrics) or list of scalars (if the model has multiple outputs
and/or metrics). The attribute \sphinxtitleref{model.backend.metrics\_names} will
give you the display labels for the scalar outputs.

\end{description}\end{quote}

Fit the model.

See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{keras.models.Model.fit()}} for more details.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Union}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{List}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}{]}{]}) \textendash{} input data.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} labels.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{batch\_size}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} number of samples per gradient update.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{epochs}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} number of epochs to train the model.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} 0, 1, or 2. Verbosity mode. 0 = silent, 1 = verbose,
2 = one log line per epoch.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{History}}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A \sphinxtitleref{keras.callbacks.History} instance. Its history attribute
contains all information collected during training.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\PYG{g+gp}{... }        \PYG{n}{params} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{engine}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ParamTable}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }        \PYG{n}{params}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{engine}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Param}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{num\PYGZus{}eggs}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{512}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }        \PYG{n}{params}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{engine}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Param}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ham\PYGZus{}type}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Parma Ham}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{params}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{my\PYGZus{}model} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{MyModel}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{my\PYGZus{}model}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{build}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{512 eggs}
\PYG{g+go}{and Parma Ham}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Notice that all parameters must be serialisable for the entire model
to be serialisable. Therefore, it’s strongly recommended to use python
native data types to store parameters.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{save() (matchzoo.engine.base\_model.BaseModel method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo.engine.base_model.BaseModel.save}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{save}}}{\emph{dirpath}}{}
Save the model.

A saved model is represented as a directory with two files. One is a
model parameters file saved by \sphinxtitleref{pickle}, and the other one is a model
h5 file saved by \sphinxtitleref{keras}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dirpath}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Union}}{[}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Path}}{]}) \textendash{} directory path of the saved model

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

Hyper parameter search spaces wrapping \sphinxtitleref{hyperopt}.
\index{HyperoptProxy (class in matchzoo.engine.hyper\_spaces)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo.engine.hyper_spaces.HyperoptProxy}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.engine.hyper\_spaces.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{HyperoptProxy}}}{\emph{hyperopt\_func}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

Hyperopt proxy class.

See \sphinxtitleref{hyperopt}’s documentation for more details:
\sphinxurl{https://github.com/hyperopt/hyperopt/wiki/FMin}

Reason of these wrappers:
\begin{quote}

A hyper space in \sphinxtitleref{hyperopt} requires a \sphinxtitleref{label} to instantiate. This
\sphinxtitleref{label} is used later as a reference to original hyper space that is
sampled. In \sphinxtitleref{matchzoo}, hyper spaces are used in
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.engine.Param}}. Only if a hyper space’s label
matches its parent \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.engine.Param}}’s name, \sphinxtitleref{matchzoo}
can correctly back-refrenced the parameter got sampled. This can be
done by asking the user always use the same name for a parameter and
its hyper space, but typos can occur. As a result, these wrappers
are created to hide hyper spaces’ \sphinxtitleref{label}, and always correctly
bind them with its parameter’s name.
\end{quote}
\paragraph{Example}

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{hyperopt}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{pyll}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{stochastic} \PYG{k}{import} \PYG{n}{sample}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{numbers} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{sample}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{choice}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{options}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{numbers}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{numbers}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{numbers}
\PYG{g+go}{True}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sample}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{quniform}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{low}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{high}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{9}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{digit}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{9}
\PYG{g+go}{True}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

The boolean value of a {\hyperref[\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo.engine.param.Param}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Param}}}}} instance is only \sphinxtitleref{True}
when the value is not \sphinxtitleref{None}. This is because some default falsy values
like zero or an empty list are valid parameter values. In other words,
the boolean value means to be “if the parameter value is filled”.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{param} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Param}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{dropout}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{param}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{OK}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{param} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Param}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{dropout}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{param}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{OK}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{OK}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

A \sphinxtitleref{\_pre\_assignment\_hook} is initialized as a data type convertor if the
value is set as a number to keep data type consistency of the parameter.
This conversion supports python built-in numbers, \sphinxtitleref{numpy} numbers, and
any number that inherits \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{numbers.Number}}.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%

\subsubsection{matchzoo.engine.tune module}
\label{\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo-engine-tune-module}}\label{\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:module-matchzoo.engine.tune}}\index{matchzoo.engine.tune (module)}
Tuner class. Currently a minimum working demo.
\index{tune() (in module matchzoo.engine.tune)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo.engine.tune.tune}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.engine.tune.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{tune}}}{\emph{model}, \emph{max\_evals=32}}{}
Tune the \sphinxtitleref{model} \sphinxtitleref{max\_evals} times.

Construct a hyper parameter searching space by extracting all parameters
in \sphinxtitleref{model} that have a defined hyper space. Then, using \sphinxtitleref{hyperopt} API,
iteratively sample parameters and test for loss, and pick the best trial
out of all. Currently a minimum working demo.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{matchzoo.engine:matchzoo.engine.base_model.BaseModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseModel}}}}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{max\_evals}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of evaluations of a single tuning process.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A list of trials of the tuning process.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\paragraph{Example}

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{matchzoo}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{models} \PYG{k}{import} \PYG{n}{DenseBaselineModel}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{model} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DenseBaselineModel}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{max\PYGZus{}evals} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{4}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{trials} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tune}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{model}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{max\PYGZus{}evals}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{trials}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{max\PYGZus{}evals}
\PYG{g+go}{True}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

A saved \sphinxtitleref{DataPack} is represented as a directory with a \sphinxtitleref{DataPack}

saved by \sphinxtitleref{pickle}.

\index{NgramLetterUnit (class in matchzoo.preprocessors)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo:matchzoo.preprocessors.NgramLetterUnit}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.preprocessors.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{NgramLetterUnit}}}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{matchzoo:matchzoo.preprocessors.StatefulProcessorUnit}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matchzoo.preprocessors.StatefulProcessorUnit}}}}}

Process unit for n-letter generation.

Triletter is used in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DSSMModel}}.
This processor is expected to execute after \sphinxtitleref{Vocab}
has been created.

Returned \sphinxtitleref{input\_dim} is the dimensionality of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DSSMModel}}.
\index{fit() (matchzoo.preprocessors.NgramLetterUnit method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo:matchzoo.preprocessors.NgramLetterUnit.fit}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{fit}}}{\emph{tokens}, \emph{ngram=3}}{}
Fiitting parameters (shape of word hashing layer) for :DSSM:.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tokens}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} list of tokens to be fitted.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ngram}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} By default use 3-gram (tri-letter).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{transform() (matchzoo.preprocessors.NgramLetterUnit method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{matchzoo:matchzoo.preprocessors.NgramLetterUnit.transform}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{transform}}}{\emph{tokens}, \emph{ngram=3}}{}
Transform token into tri-letter.

For example, \sphinxtitleref{word} should be represented as \sphinxtitleref{\#wo},
\sphinxtitleref{wor}, \sphinxtitleref{ord} and \sphinxtitleref{rd\#}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tokens}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} list of tokens to be transformed.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ngram}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} By default use 3-gram (tri-letter).

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
set of tri-letters, dependent on \sphinxtitleref{ngram}.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
